page.title: 17Wood worker/Kirtlebridge
page.content: Mr Crouch was workshop manager of a Youth Training workshop. About 5 years ago he decided to set up business making pine wood furniture and small items. He has had no training and learned through experience. He has an Enterprise Allowance of Â£40 a week for a year. Mr and Mrs Crouch decided that as women usually buy furniture it might be a good idea to have furniture parties, on the same lines as Tupperware parties. This seems to be a success. The wood used is Scandanavian Red Pine. The best wood comes from Russia but is too expensive. The colder the climate the better the wood, as slow grown wood is best quality. All the wood is kiln dried.
